thread.title: How Pennsylvania Slashed Coal Emissions Without Alienating Industry

author: Kris Maher
title: How Pennsylvania Slashed Coal Emissions Without Alienating Industry
text:
Coal-fired power plants in Pennsylvania cut smog-forming emissions by more than half last year, in a rare regulatory effort that has won support from both industry officials and environmentalists.
Emissions of nitrogen oxides, or NOx, at the stateâ€™s six power plants that burn newly mined coal exclusively fell 60% last year from the year earlier to 23,133 tons.
